data.name: UnknownUsageE7Paragraph1
data.value:
The costs below are based on the estimated usage we worked out from the answers you gave us about your property. We estimate you’ll use: {0} Electricity day = {1} kWh per year   Electricity night = {2} kWh per year.
These figures are based on 58% usage during the day and 42% usage at night.

data.name: UnknownUsageParagraph1
data.value: The costs below are based on the estimated usage we worked out from the answers you gave us about your property. We estimate you’ll use: {0} .

data.name: TILParagraphAboveInformation
data.value: Our online home is at sse.co.uk. So, the Tariff Information Label (TIL) for all our tariffs show SSE as the supplier. But the prices are also correct for our other brands SSE Southern Electric, SSE SWALEC and SSE Scottish Hydro.

data.name: TILParagraphUnderInformation
data.value: Estimated costs include any discounts and VAT (currently 5%) and are based on current prices for the tariff shown above. The prices quoted may be different to how these are displayed on your bill. If your tariff type is Evergreen, then please note that prices are not fixed and may rise in the future.

data.name: TilSubHeaderParagraph
data.value: kWh stands for kilowatt-hour - the unit used to measure the amount of electricity you use. One kilowatt equals 1,000 watts of electricity and will power a 40-watt light bulb for 25 hours.

data.name: TILLExitFeeLabel
data.value: Exit fee (if you cancel this tariff before the end date)

data.name: SmartTariffTILText
data.value: £50 electricity credit at the end of the tariff subject to your terms and conditions

data.name: ChosenTariffNotAvailableMessage
data.value: Sorry, but based on the information provided you won’t be able to get the tariff you selected.

data.name: ChosenTariffOtherTariffsHeader
data.value: You might also be interested in

data.name: ChosenTariffSubHeader
data.value: Or choose one of our other tariffs

data.name: TILSwitchParagraph
data.value: If you’re a Pay As You Go customer with a debt of less than £500, it’s now even easier to switch. The Debt Assignment Protocol allows you to change supplier and take your debt with you. If your current energy supplier successfully objects to you moving supply because of your debt balance the Debt Assignment Protocol is activated, allowing the switch to continue. It isn’t guaranteed, but it could be an option if you want to switch. To switch your supply, we’ll need to exchange your account details and debt information with your current energy supplier. By agreeing to continue the switch after the Debt Assignment Protocol has been activated, you agree that we can share this information. Find out more in our

data.name: TILSwitchSubHeader
data.value: Can I switch supplier with a debt on my Pay As You Go meter?

data.name: SwitchBundle1
data.value: Sign up – choose a Bundle with energy, plus broadband and phone, or a boiler and heating product

data.name: SwitchBundle2
data.value: Sit back – no need to contact your current energy or broadband provider (unless you’re with Virgin Media)

data.name: SwitchBundle3
data.value: Relax – we’ll sort out your switch and keep you posted at every step

data.name: SwitchBundle4
data.value: Save – pay less compared to buying our equivalent standalone products!

data.name: SwitchHeaderBundle
data.value: It’s easy to switch and save with our Bundles

data.name: SwitchGuaranteeTextBundle
data.value: We promise to switch your gas and electricity within 21 days. Switching your broadband and phone usually takes around 18 to 20 days. Boiler and heating products start on the next working day after your energy supply switches to us.

data.name: SwitchGuaranteeTextEnergy
data.value: We promise to complete your switch in no more than 21 days.

data.name: PartnershipText
data.value: As we’re now part of the OVO family, we may have cheaper tariff options for you, although some may have eligibility criteria. To find out more, visit ovoenergy.com or call 0330 303 5063, boostpower.co.uk or call 0330 102 7517, or sparkenergy.co.uk or call 0345 034 7474.
